Title: Speed up Adobe reader or switch to Foxit Reader

Author: nazgulnarsil
Content:
PG's essay on essays helped me a lot when I was stagnating.  particularly his metaphor of a river.  looking at the overall flow of a piece and shaping it with editing has immensely improved my writing.
I now enjoy deciding whether to make an essay inductive or deductive, and playing with the order in which I introduce things to create weird effects (used a lot by one of my favorites Douglas Adams).

Author: SingAlong
Title: Ask HN: Is there any text-to-speech API or library for web apps?
Content: Is there any text-to-speech API or library? I am developing a web mashup and looking for text-to-speech conversion. The content of the site changes, so I can't depend on a virtual character with pre-set text. And the app I am developing is going to be hosted on Google appengine, so if there's any server-side stuff involved, then it needs to be python.

Author: binglo
Content:
Regarding battery technology, if I'm not mistaken, that's already a solved problem: Lithium-Ion batteries have great capacity and are quite light. Their only problem is "venting with flame" if you don't charge/discharge them within their limits, but electronic control can mostly eliminate that.

Now we just need a battery company to start making car-battery-sized Li-Ion's and sell them for a reasonable price. When that happens, I think you'll see some serious action.

Author: binglo
Content: Converting cars to electric is ... not optimal. Cars are built very heavy these days due to "safety concerns". They're also heavy because they're loaded with features. It's very unlikely that you can find a nice light minimalist car that you can successfully convert, but if you know of any, I'd love to hear about them.

Author: lacker
Content: Why would you want to type "a guide to setting up a new tv that's easy enough for my mother to use" when you could just type... what? Keywordese is not as rich as natural language.

Author: lacker
Content:
I hope natural language interfaces eventually work. Not just for web search as we use it today, for all sorts of things. Think how great Hacker News would be if you could search for

[well written articles about concurrent programming, written by people who actually know what they're talking about]

Just try to get that with a keyword search ;-)

Author: noonespecial
Content:
I find it very compelling that this otherwise ordinary lady's words may very well be with us forever. (Or at least so long as our society lasts.)

I sometimes find myself wishing more older people would start blogging so that what knowlege they carry will not be lost.

Author: muhfuhkuh
Content:
A culture that prizes freedom over community breeds alot of action for the sake of it. You know, the whole "because fuck it, that's why" mentality.

Additionally, Tokyo, as a populace, is much more collective and like-minded. A hive-mind, to be more blunt and offensive. Individual actions are taken in context of the whole rather than analyzed by itself. Thus, there is just about only bowing as a greeting there; whereas in the US, there's your choice of fist-bumps, high-fives, daps, pounds, pound-hugs, skins, or variations thereof. It's even distinctive by region or even state and city, or RACE.

So, because fuck it, that's why.
